PhD position Cell Biology (1,0 fte)
results.description: The project is part of the ZonMW TOP-grant “Early developmental processes underlying sensory deficits in neurodevelopmental disorders”. The aim of this collaborative project is to determine how early activity and synaptic function precisely determine network function later in life. The PhD student will use a combination of virus technology (both in vitro and in vivo) and electrophysiology in brain slices to manipulate and study maturation of synapses in the cortex.

The focus of our research is to understand the mechanisms of enhancer mediated deregulation of gene expression in acute myeloid leukemia. The program has been awarded with the Dutch Cancer Research price. You will be working in a research team studying molecular defects in acute myeloid leukemia. results.description: This project is part of a NWO VIDI grant awarded to Prof. Floor Rink.
